title: Philippines: Ninth Citi Junior Bankers Congress Graduates Feted
summary: Manila - Citi Philippines and the FINEX Research and Development Foundation, Inc. tag-1: Philippines: Ninth Citi Junior Bankers Congress Graduates Feted
tag-2: Manila – Citi Philippines and the FINEX Research and Development Foundation, Inc. (FINEX Foundation) recently celebrated the completion of the Ninth Citi Junior Bankers Congress with a fellowship dinner in honor of its student graduates. Funded by the Citi Foundation, the CJBC is a signature citizenship program of Citi that aims to train and provide job opportunities to the top students of state universities and colleges in the country.
tag-3: The fellowship dinner capped off a successful program that trained nearly 500 low-income students, enrolled over 400 of them in a mentoring program with FINEX member executives and placed over 100 students into permanent jobs with FINEX member companies. In the ceremonial toast to the graduates, Citi Country Officer Sanjiv Vohra was joined by members of the Citi senior management team, along with FINEX Foundation president Ronnie Alcantara.
tag-4: "Citi remains committed to helping shape the future leaders of the banking industry. We believe in inclusive growth for all sectors and this is why we have extended the program to include deserving students from top public academic institutions across the country. It is a sincere effort to democratize training and development, and make the program accessible to talented public school students nationwide," said Vohra.
tag-5: Vohra also gave the students practical advice on career advancement. "The key to success is to always learn, stay humble and work as a team," he added. He also congratulated them for taking advantage of this opportunity to train under top-caliber professionals in the financial industry.
tag-6: Alcantara echoed Vohra's message, saying that the program, along with other FINEX initiative, helps raise the bar in the development of finance professionals in the country.
tag-7: "We enjoyed working with Citibank on this project and the response from the students has been very fulfilling for the Finex volunteers," related Ned Goseco, program manager for Finex Foundation.
tag-8: The ninth run of CJBC started in November 2011 with more than 200 student participants from state universities attending the regional congress held in Luzon, Visayas, and Mindanao. The participants represented the top 20 percent of graduating finance students from the country's top state universities. As part of the program, more than 100 students were provided internship placements and mentorships in the country's top 1000 corporations.
